    Simple subgradientL1Regression function.

    subgradientL1Regression.Rd

    SubgradientL1Regression solves y approx x beta

    subgradientL1Regression(
  y,
  x,
  s = 0.01,
  percentvals = 0.1,
  nits = 100,
  betas = NA,
  sparval = NA
)

    Arguments

    y

    outcome variable

    x

    predictor matrix

    s

    gradient descent parameter

    percentvals

    percent of values to use each iteration

    nits

    number of iterations

    betas

    initial guess at solution

    sparval

    sparseness

    Value

    output has a list of summary items

    Author

    Avants BB

    Examples

    
mat <- replicate(1000, rnorm(200))
y <- rnorm(200)
wmat <- subgradientL1Regression(y, mat, percentvals = 0.05)
print(wmat$resultcorr)
#>       cor 
#> 0.7699053
